Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Wednesday February 19), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for wednesday, february 19th. meta platforms is reportedly testing a new subscription service for its social media apps, which could change the ad-based revenue model that's fueled its growth. the test includes features like an ad-free experience and exclusive access to new tools for subscribers. this move comes as meta faces increasing scrutiny over data privacy and ad tracking practices.

over in the world of electric vehicles, rivian has announced plans to expand its production capacity with a new manufacturing facility in georgia. the plant is set to produce its latest models, including the r1t pickup truck and r1s suv, aiming to meet rising demand in the competitive ev market.

meanwhile, google is introducing a suite of ai-powered features for its productivity apps, promising to enhance user productivity and streamline workflows. these updates are part of google's broader strategy to integrate ai technologies into its products, providing users with more intuitive and efficient tools.

in the semiconductor industry, taiwan semiconductor manufacturing company (tsmc) is investing in new u.s. facilities as part of its ongoing efforts to diversify production locations. the move addresses the global chip shortage while also reducing reliance on asian manufacturing hubs.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for wednesday, february 19th. 

meta platforms is reportedly testing a subscription service for its social media apps. this potential shift could significantly alter the ad-based revenue model that has long driven the company's growth. the subscription service test includes features like an ad-free experience and exclusive access to new tools for subscribers. this move comes as meta faces growing scrutiny over data privacy and ad tracking practices.

in the electric vehicle sector, rivian has announced plans for a new manufacturing facility in georgia. the plant is set to boost production capacity for the r1t pickup truck and r1s suv, meeting rising demand in the highly competitive ev market.

meanwhile, google is rolling out a suite of ai-powered features for its productivity apps. these updates aim to enhance user productivity and streamline workflows, reflecting google's broader strategy to integrate ai technologies across its product line, offering users more intuitive and efficient tools.

in the semiconductor industry, taiwan semiconductor manufacturing company, or tsmc, is investing in new u.s. facilities. this strategic move not only addresses the global chip shortage but also aims to reduce reliance on asian manufacturing hubs, diversifying production locations.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-220 Meta's Subscription Shift 💼, Rivian's Georgia Expansion 🚙, and Google's Ai Productivity Push 🤖
Podcast Description:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for wednesday, february 19th. here's what's happening in the tech world today:

  • meta's subscription service testing: meta platforms is exploring a subscription model for its social media apps, aiming to shift from ad-based revenue by offering an ad-free experience and exclusive tools amidst data privacy scrutiny.
  • rivian's expansion in georgia: rivian unveils plans for a new manufacturing plant in georgia to increase production for its r1t pickup truck and r1s suv, responding to the growing demand in the ev market.
  • google enhances productivity with ai: google introduces ai-powered features in its productivity apps, boosting user productivity and streamlining tasks, aligning with its strategy to incorporate ai widely across its products.
  • tsmc's u.s. investment move: taiwan semiconductor manufacturing company (tsmc) invests in new u.s. facilities to tackle the global chip shortage and diversify its manufacturing locations, reducing reliance on asian hubs.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow.
Image Prompt: a unified podcast cover image depicting a bustling cityscape at dusk, illuminated by the warm glow of office buildings transitioning into the evening. in the foreground, a modern electric vehicle, symbolizing rivian, is parked on a quiet street, charging smoothly at a sleek station. overhead, the sky is dotted with faintly visible satellites and digital networks, representing the omnipresence of ai and connectivity, as soft circuitry patterns and digital lines subtly weave across the skyline. in the heart of the image, an abstract representation of productivity tools and innovations, suggested through transparent digital screens and interfaces, rises from the city, symbolizing google's push in ai productivity. the composition integrates these elements seamlessly, reflecting the intersection of technology, mobility, and digital innovation present in the narratives of meta, rivian, and google
